title: Modi govt. believes in helping the last man in the queue, says Nadda
content: ‘Govt. has empowered women, farmers and marginalised sections of society by taking various measures for them, while others only talked about doing so’

title: RSS invites Bastar tribal leader to key Nagpur event
content: Will raise issues faced by tribals such as displacement and religious conversions, says former Minister and ex-Congressman Arvind Netam

title: 11-year-old Dalit rape victim dies of injuries in Patna
content: She was raped and found in a pit with 20 knife wounds in Bihar’s Muzaffarpur; Congress leader says she was left in ambulance outside Patna hospital for 5 hours before being admitted; party stages protest blaming NDA government for the death

title: Man held for hoax bomb threat at Thampanoor KSRTC bus station
content: The accused is also wanted by the Kochi City Police in connection with a similar bomb threat that targeted the Kochi Metro some months ago

title: Muthalvar Padaippagam, a co-working space, helps the budding businessmen cut cost
content: Entrepreneurs are utilising this well-equipped facility as a launch pad for their businesses. Started in 2024, it comprises a co-working space that includes meeting rooms and learning centres

title: Four more killed in northeast floods; 3.64 lakh affected in Assam; 1,500 tourists stranded in Sikkim
content: Mild to heavy rainfall continued to batter large swathes of the northeastern region, leaving 34 dead since May 28; major rivers breach embankments in Imphal; tourists stranded due to landslides in Sikkim

title: 17 women, look up to the sky
content: Seventeen women cadets graduated from Pune’s National Defence Academy on May 30, making them the first batch to participate in a joint training institution for the Indian Army, Navy, and Air Force. Snehal Mutha reports on the experiences of the cadets who took on concerns around physical training and a system that was forced to adapt itself to the needs and aspirations of women

title: New DGP faces challenge in establishing rule of law in U.P.: Mayawati
content: The newly appointed DGP Rajeev Krishna meets CM Yogi Adityanath, reiterates commitment to carry forward the priorities of government like zero tolerance towards crime and corruption, women’s safety

title: Keel laying of eighth anti-submarine warfare ship held
content: The contract for building eight ASW ships was signed between the Ministry of Defence and CSL on 30 April 2019

title: NHAI sets deadline to complete redevelopment of Kochi-Munnar NH 85 corridor
content: Resurfacing completed on around 100 km of the 124 km corridor being upgraded with a 10-metre-wide tarred carriageway. Sharp curves, including hairpin bends, are being widened, but work has been temporarily halted due to heavy rainfall, officials say

title: Double-engine government in Bihar failed to save a 11-year-old Dalit rape victim, says Congress
content: Congress leaders accuse the State government of negligence, claiming that the girl could have been saved had she been given proper treatment

title: Illegal gambling platforms pose grave threat to Indian youth: Report
content: The report reveals that from April 2024 to March 2025, the top 15 illegal gambling platforms garnered over 5.4 billion visits through 40 mirror sites.

title: Tamil Nadu among top heat-risk States in country; warmer nights put people at risk
content: Tamil Nadu ranks fifth among Indian States with high to very high heat risk, according to the study by the Council on Energy, Environment and Water

title: Vijayashanti seeks Cabinet berth surprising many in the party
content: The popular actor of yesteryears had switched to the Congress from the BJP just before the elections and was largely inactive on the ground during the election campaign

title: Transport dept. to give work order to roll out advanced smart cards for driving licenses and vehicle registrations
content: The new smart cards will replace the current polyvinyl chloride (PVC) cards that have been in use for years. These advanced cards are seen as a leap forward in modernising transport documentation, combining robust materials and secure data storage methods

title: Karnataka achieves drastic reduction in ‘overdue’ cases before revenue courts: Minister
content: The experiment of Karnataka has created a social impact by reducing litigation, harassment and expenses for farmers, says Revenue Minister Krishna Byre Gowda

title: "Troubling": Bar Body Chief Seeks Release Of Influencer Sharmishta Panoli
content: Bar Council of India (BCI) chairman Manan Kumar Mishra on Sunday called for immediate release and fair trial for Sharmishta Panoli, the Instagram influencer who was arrested by Kolkata Police.

title: KCR Family Differences Cast Long Shadow On Telangana Foundation Day
content: June 2 is a red-letter day in the history of India's youngest state -- the day has been observed as Telangana Formation Day for over a decade.

title: 4 More Covid Cases Reported In Gurugram, Total At 23
content: Four more people were diagnosed with coronavirus infection in Gurugram on Sunday, a health department official said.

title: Cops Say Influencer's Arrest Over Communal Post Lawful, BJP Slams Trinamool
content: Dimissing claims that an Instagram influencer, who uploaded a video with alleged communal comments in reference to Operation Sindoor was arrested unlawfully, the Kolkata Police has said several attempts were made to serve notice to her.

title: 7,000 Take Shelter In Relief Camps As Heavy Rain Triggers Floods In Tripura
content: Continuous rainfall across Tripura has caused water levels to surge in several low-lying areas, displacing hundreds of families and forcing them to take shelter in schools and government office buildings now serving as temporary relief camps.

title: "Secularism Must Be 2-Way Street": Pawan Kalyan Slams Influencer's Arrest
content: Kolkata Police's move to arrest influencer Sharmistha Panoli over a communal post has sparked a political row

title: MK Stalin Launches Poll Campaign, Says AIADMK "Fully Under" BJP's Control
content: The temple town of Madurai, the political capital of Tamil Nadu, crackled with political energy as the Chief Minister and DMK President, M.K. Stalin, formally launched the party's campaign for the 2026 elections at the general council meet.

title: Congress Demands Special Session On Op Sindoor, BJP Says 'Opportunity Soon'
content: With opposition parties demanding a special Parliament session in light of Operation Sindoor, Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Sunday asserted that the government has nothing to hide.

title: Video: IndiGo Flight Hit By Turbulence Due To Delhi Storm, Landing Aborted
content: The pilot of an IndiGo flight aborted landing after the aircraft experienced severe turbulence as Delhi and surrounding areas experienced rainfall, storm and gusty winds.

title: Ukrainian Drones Strike Multiple Airbases in Russia, Over 40 Aircraft Hit
content: The Russian governor of the Irkutsk region confirmed the attack, saying Ukrainian remote-piloted aircraft attacked a military unit in the village of Sridni, the first such attack in Siberia.

title: 'Allies Like China No Longer Expect Us To Come With Begging Bowl': Pak PM
content: Pakistan PM talked about "improved ties" between Islamabad and its allies like China, Azerbaijan, Saudi Arabia, UAE, Turkey and said they (allies) don't expect Pakistan to go with a "begging bowl" to them.

title: As BJP Completes 100 Days In Delhi, Opposition Raises Complaints
content: BJP's return to Delhi after 26 years - with an almost 70 per cent majority - led to widespread celebrations, but the days that followed were anything but easy.

title: Indian YouTuber Detained In Turkey Over Derogatory Remarks On Women: Report
content: An Indian content creator has reportedly been detained in Turkey after massive outrage over his derogatory remarks targeting Turkish women.

title: "Utter Nonsense": Royal Trouble For Netflix Show 'The Royals'
content: Netflix web series 'The Royals' has run into royal trouble. Members of erstwhile royal families in different parts of India have criticised the way royal households have been portrayed in the Ishaan Khatter-Bhumi Pednekar-starrer

title: 'PM Should Step Back From Campaigning, Focus On Enemy': Mallikarjun Kharge
content: Commenting on Prime Minister Narendra Modi's public speeches after Operation Sindoor, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge urged him to "focus on the enemy" and step back from himself from election campaigns for the time being.

title: Analysis: India's Big Political Families And Their Bitter Feuds
content: Every regional political party in India, barring one or two notable exceptions like the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) in Tamil Nadu, are a family enterprise. Succession battles put father against son, brother against brother.

title: 'Adani Group Never Backed Down, Emerged More Formidable': Gautam Adani
content: Adani Group is set to invest $15-20 billion over the next five years across businesses, the company's Chairman Gautam Adani has said, touting the Group's strong balance sheet and robust business growth.

title: 'Not One Day Wasted': Rekha Gupta On 100 Days Of Her Government In Delhi
content: The BJP-led Delhi government completed its 100 days in office. Chief Minister Rekha Gupta said not a single day has been wasted, with steps being taken in every sector to lay the foundation for a 'Viksit Delhi' (Developed Delhi).

title: Over 1,200 Tourists Stranded Amid Rain, Landslides, Rising Rivers In Sikkim
content: As monsoon tightens its grip on North Sikkim, more than 1,276 domestic tourists and two foreign nationals remain stranded in the picturesque but now perilous valleys of Lachen and Lachung in Mangan district.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' Lawyers Say Ex-Assistant's Social Media Undercuts Rape Charge
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs ' lawyers confronted his rape-alleging former personal assistant with her social media posts praising the hip-hop mogul as a mentor, "my brother" and "friend for life" for years after she says he assaulted her.

title: President withholds assent to Malayalam Bill without giving reason in violation of SC order
content: Act leads to a constitutional challenge since as per the April 8 judgement of the SC in the Tamil Nadu Governor case, the President cannot exercise an absolute veto on Bills and cannot withhold assent without furnishing reasons

title: Free distribution of ‘kodelu’ (bulls) relaunched following death of 13 ‘kodelu’ at Vemulawada temple goshala
content: The pathetic condition of most of the kodelu in the overcrowded goshala sparked outrage among devotees

title: Political slugfest breaks out between Opposition and Congress over Hemavathi river link canal project
content: Congress MLAs HD Ranganath and HC Balakrishna for early completion of the project, while BJP and JD (S) legislators claim the project aimed to diver Hemavathi water to Ramanagara

title: New academic year: traffic regulations come into effect in Thiruvananthapuram city
content: Series of traffic regulations introduced to ensure the safe and smooth transportation of school and college students across the city

title: Scholarship camp for higher education evokes good response in Nagapattinam
content: A total of 483 applications were submitted by 200 students, with guidance from 42 trained volunteers from Talent Quest India and TNAU Kilvelur in the camp organised by the district administration

title: Somanna slams Siddaramaiah for implicating farmers opposing Hemavathi link canal project
content: The Central Minister says that the Chief Minister now-a-days is ‘like a train that missed the village station’

title: IUML questions Satheesan’s handling of Anvar issue
content: At a meeting, leaders like K.M. Shaji and M.K. Muneer question IUML’s silence when Satheesan ‘mishandled Anvar issue through a delaying tactic’

title: Multi-party delegations are to secure support for India, not highlight domestic political differences, says Salman Khurshid
content: Congress leader is part of the delegation that has visited Japan, Singapore, South Korea, Indonesia and Malaysia

title: Tej Pratap breaks his silence a week after expulsion from RJD
content: Without naming anyone, he says in a social media post that there are people hatching a conspiracy to separate him from younger brother Tejaswhi Yadav

title: Implement ‘cost plus 50% formula’ while fixing MSP, farmers’ body urges the Union government
content: No crop in Andhra Pradesh is currently receiving even the minimum support price, alleges Vadde Sobhanadreeswara Rao

title: A 100 years and Hyderabad turns into Urbs Humungous
content: From the 1591 axial roads to suburbs planned in 1930-1944 Outer Circular Road to the planned 340-km Regional Ring Road, planners of Hyderabad have built on layers of legacy

title: Address water woes of Rayalaseema, CPI leader tells Chief Minister Naidu and Deputy CM Pawan
content: It is not correct on the part of the government to take up the Godavari-Banakacherla project without completing the pending schemes, says CPI State secretary Ramakrishna

title: BDJS pledges support to Mohan George in Nilambur
content: Party to organise family gatherings and public conventions as part of its campaign strategy in Nilambur

title: Waqf protests against Modi government, not Hindu community: AIMPLB president Maulana Khalid Saifullah Rahmani
content: The Central government has put its ‘agents’ to work to break unity against Waqf Act, Maulana Rahmani claimed

title: BJP fields Kerala Congress leader as party’s candidate in Nilambur
content: Kerala Congress leader Mons Joseph denies LDF’s accusation that Mohan George was a party member. LDF counters it by publishing photographs of Mr. George attending Kerala Congress district convention in Malappuram last month

title: Kottayam Textiles to reopen on June 2 after a hiatus of over five years
content: The Textiles Corporation has already placed orders for new machinery and modern equipment as part of an upgrade initiative, using ₹8 crore sanctioned by the State government. In the latest State Budget, the government allocated a ₹40-crore package aimed at the future development of the unit

title: Machilipatnam decked up for Masula Beach Festival to be organised from June 5 to 8
content: Excise Minister Kollu Ravindra visits Manginapudi beach and reviews the arrangements being made for the festival

title: India warms to foreign law firms, but legal concerns simmer
content: Support for foreign firms and lawyers’ entry is tempered by worries over reciprocity and conflict with Supreme Court rulings

title: CPI(M) opposes move to give money in place of ration goods in Andhra Pradesh
content: Disburse fine quality rice through the PDS to prevent its illegal transportation, says CPI(M) State secretary Srinivasa Rao

title: Momentum in favour of UDF in bypoll, says KPCC chief
content: Electoral contests are part of politics and should not be seen as personal rivalry, says Sunny Joseph

title: NHAI chairperson reviews progress of National Highway projects in Thiruvananthapuram and Kollam
content: Inspection also covered key locations such as Enchakkal, Kazhakuttom, Chembakamangalam, Kottiyam, and Mevaram

title: We’re ready to raise Almatti dam height if there are no legal problems, says Minister
content: We will consult our legal team and go ahead with it, if it will not invite any legal challenges, according to M.B. Patil

title: ANPR cameras installed at eight locations in two blocks of Perambalur district
content: The high resolution cameras have been installed at eight places and are linked to the central monitoring room which will function round-the-clock to strengthen surveillance

title: Composite Backwardness Index of BCs to be gauged on a scale of Zero to 126
content: The Expert Committee report is likely to be submitted to Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy in two weeks with rankings for all 245 castes that were surveyed

title: NBA Finals first look: 7 things to know ahead of Pacers-Thunder
content: What are the most important matchups? What history is at stake? Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton take an early look at Thunder-Pacers.

title: Art of the comeback: How to quantify this NBA playoffs' growing trend
content: Don't be surprised to see a major comeback in the Finals because nobody has mastered the art like the Pacers.

title: 'Special' Pacers top Knicks, punch Finals ticket
content: Pascal Siakam earned Eastern Conference MVP honors after leading the Pacers to a Game 6 victory over the Knicks to set up a date with the Thunder in the Finals.

title: Two dead after PSG fans celebrate UCL final win
content: French authorities have said two fans died and a police officer is in a coma after celebrations around the country erupted for Paris-Saint Germain's historic Champions League victory.

title: Russell: 'Unnecessary' Max crash felt deliberate
content: George Russell said Max Verstappen's move on him felt deliberate and suggested the four-time world champion is a bad example for kids watching Formula 1.

title: Trans athlete wins 2 titles at Calif. track champs
content: Transgender athlete AB Hernandez took home gold in the girls' high jump and the triple jump at the California high school track and field championship Saturday.

title: Phils moving Walker to relief in bullpen shakeup
content: The Phillies made moves to restructure their bullpen Sunday, removing Taijuan Walker from the rotation and recalling right-handed reliever Seth Johnson.

title: Svitolina, Swiatek rally to reach French quarters
content: Elina Svitolina, Iga Swiatek and Aryna Sabalenka all overcame early troubles to advance to the quarterfinals at the French Open.

title: Man United officially lands Wolves star Cunha
content: Manchester United have agreed the signing of forward Matheus Cunha from Wolves pending visa and registration processes, the club announced on Sunday.

title: LAFC secures last CWC spot in dramatic fashion
content: Denis Bouanga scored a goal in the 115th minute to secure a 2-1 victory for Los Angeles FC over Club America in the Club World Cup play-in match at BMO Stadium on Saturday night.

title: Takeaways: Why the Knicks got pummeled by the Pacers in Game 6
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: Has Iga Swiatek just turned her season around?
content: Why Iga Swiatek's fourth-round win over Elena Rybakina at the French Open could be absolutely pivotal.

title: The NBA should be terrified of this OKC team
content: The Thunder have followed in the footsteps of the 2014-15 Warriors this season. Is this a future dynasty?

title: How Freddie Freeman's World Series grand slam changed him -- and Dodgers fans -- forever
content: There are bobbleheads, T-shirts, tattoos -- and even one fan, according to Freeman, who said he hadn't touched a drink since.

title: Panthers-Oilers II: Key stats to know for the 2025 Stanley Cup Final
content: For the second consecutive season, it's Florida-Edmonton. Here's what you need to know before Game 1.

title: PSG win first Champions League by utterly humiliating Inter Milan
content: Led by 19-year-old Désiré Doué, a young PSG side embarrassed an experienced Inter Milan in the UEFA Champions League final.

title: The Americans still playing at the 2025 French Open
content: American star Coco Gauff and newcomer Hailey Baptiste are still in the draw at the French Open -- but who else is? We break it down.

title: PSG rout Inter in record UCL final win for 1st title
content: Paris Saint-Germain won their first Champions League title with a 5-0 demolition of Inter Milan -- the biggest winning margin in the final of the competition.

title: Luis Enrique honors late daughter after UCL final
content: Paris Saint-Germain manager Luis Enrique honoured his late daughter, Xana, by planting the French club's flag on the pitch after winning the Champions League final.

title: Brilliant Messi helps Miami win big before CWC
content: Lionel Messi scored for the fifth time in three Major League Soccer matches to help Inter Miami rout the Columbus Crew 5-1 on Saturday night.

title: 'Momma Em' helps LaBonta make USWNT history
content: Lo'eau LaBonta became the oldest player to debut in the USWNT's history on Saturday when she appeared during the 3-0 win over China.

title: Mbappé, Neymar salute PSG on UCL title win
content: Kylian Mbappé congratulated Paris Saint-Germain after his former club won their first Champions League title on Saturday.

title: Victorious PSG eye 'cherry on the cake' at CWC
content: Luis Enrique said Paris Saint-Germain want to "continue to conquer" by making the FIFA Club World Cup the "cherry on the cake" after winning their Champions League title.

title: Inzaghi won't rule out Inter exit after final loss
content: Simone Inzaghi cast doubt on his future as Inter Milan coach following his team's 5-0 Champions League final defeat against Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Antony says farewell to Betis: 'Felt like home'
content: Antony has thanked Real Betis for helping to "find a piece" of himself as he comes to the end of a six-month loan spell that sees him return to Manchester United.

title: Is Shedeur Sanders set up to win QB battle in Browns' new-look offense?
content: The Browns have a lot of new faces on offense, including at coordinator and under center, as they reshape the unit.

title: Men's summer transfer grades: Man United get a B for Cunha
content: The summer transfer window is now open, and clubs are starting to do business. Here is how we rate the biggest moves.

title: LAFC can now chase global dreams at Club World Cup after Club América comeback
content: LAFC want to be a global brand and have now punched a ticket to the 2025 Club World Cup with a thrilling comeback win over Club America.

title: CFP format debate: Would SEC change cost bids? Does the 11+5 model make the most sense?
content: The debate about the future format of the CFP is raging. Particularly, how it hurts or helps the biggest leagues.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United turn to Goncalves to replace Fernandes
content: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim could raid former club Sporting CP to sign midfielder Pedro Gonçalves. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: The first transfer window is set to open across Europe on June 1, so what are the top clubs planning?

title: Updated NBA draft rankings: How the NCAA withdrawal deadline shook up the top 100
content: With 18 of our top 100 NBA prospects returning to college, there's movement in our list, starting at No. 5.

title: NBA draft withdrawal deadline: NIL's impact, Florida's gain, the 2026 draft, more
content: Who are biggest winners and losers from prospects' decisions to stay or go? We answer the burning questions.

title: Conference USA preview: Liberty is early favorite but contenders abound
content: The Flames are the team to beat, but Western Kentucky and Jacksonville State (among others) can't be counted out.

title: Why the Maple Leafs shouldn't re-sign Mitch Marner -- and what they should do instead
content: Toronto has some franchise-altering decisions to make this summer, starting with the perennial All-Star.

title: Anti-drug campaign launched in Irinjalakuda
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! Thrissur Aiming to create a drug-free Irinjalakuda, the campagna .

title: Zelenskyy’s ‘spider web’: How Ukraine 'hid' drones and struck Russian bombers worth $7bn
content: Ukraine's SBU reportedly executed Operation Spider Web, striking four Russian airbases with FPV drones smuggled in trucks. The covert assault, allegedly overseen by Zelenskyy, damaged or destroyed over 40 military aircraft, costing Russia billions. While Ukraine hasn't formally claimed responsibility, the operation coincided with escalating aerial assaults and ceasefire talks.

title: IndiGo flight hit by major turbulence, pilot aborts Delhi landing - Video
content: An IndiGo flight from Raipur to Delhi aborted its landing due to a sudden dust storm and strong winds, reaching speeds of up to 80 km/h. The aircraft circled before safely landing after the weather improved.

title: Air India to shift repair work from Turkish firm' amid geopolitical tensions
content: Air India plans to decrease its reliance on Turkish Technic for wide-body aircraft maintenance due to geopolitical tensions, redirecting operations to MRO facilities in the Middle East, Southeast Asia, and the US. CEO Campbell Wilson emphasized the airline's sensitivity to national sentiment and its commitment to adjusting plans in response to recent developments.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO's warning to US on China tariffs: They're not scared...
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon cautioned American officials against underestimating China's resilience in the trade conflict, highlighting their preparedness and determination. He warned against expecting China to concede to American pressure, emphasizing their capacity to address challenges with significant resources. Dimon also expressed concerns about the United States' overall readiness for future global conflicts, particularly in military strength.

title: Rohit Sharma equals Suresh Raina's unwanted IPL knockouts record
content: Rohit Sharma's IPL knockout record reveals a struggle under pressure, marked by numerous single-digit scores, sharing a record with Suresh Raina. Despite this, his overall IPL career remains extraordinary, amassing 7,046 runs, second only to Virat Kohli. He recently played a vital knock of 80 runs in the Eliminator against Gujarat Titans, showcasing his ability to perform under pressure.

title: Watch: Ukraine blasts Russian nuclear bombers worth $2bn in daring Siberia strike
content: Ukraine has launched a significant drone attack on Russian nuclear-capable bombers stationed in Siberia, targeting the Belaya air base, which is over 4,300km from the front lines. The operation aimed to destroy Tu-95 and Tu-22 strategic bombers used by Moscow to launch long-range missiles at Ukraine, resulting in a fire at the base.

title: After a temporary truce, Airtel and Reliance Jio take on Musk's Starlink once again
content: Airtel and Reliance Jio have reignited their concerns over Trai's spectrum allocation recommendations for satcom companies, alleging bias towards satellite operators. COAI argues the recommendations are non-transparent, based on flawed assumptions, and create an uneven playing field. They also object to differential spectrum pricing, advocating for parity between terrestrial and satellite services.

title: Microsoft exec has a message for coders, after laying off 2k+ engineers
content: Despite recent layoffs impacting software engineers, Microsoft's CPO, Aparna Chennapragada, defends the importance of computer science education. She argues AI is simply another layer of abstraction, transforming roles into "software operators" rather than eliminating them. As Microsoft invests heavily in AI, project managers will also adapt, focusing on editing and refining AI-generated ideas.

title: Suryakumar Yadav surpasses AB de Villiers with IPL milestone
content: Suryakumar Yadav has surpassed AB de Villiers to become the highest-scoring non-opener in an IPL season, achieving this milestone during the Qualifier 2 clash against Punjab Kings. He eclipsed De Villiers' 2016 record with his aggressive batting style. Now, he aims to surpass Sai Sudharsan for the Orange Cap, as Mumbai Indians pursue their sixth IPL title.

title: Daughters' day? Not. MAGA takes aim at daughters of Carney and Xi
content: Amidst the Trump administration's efforts to reshape liberal US universities, daughters of prominent global leaders like Canada's prime minister and China's leader are reportedly targeted for expulsion from Harvard. This action is part of a broader crackdown on foreign students, fueled by MAGA-aligned sentiments, raising concerns about academic freedom and the value of international students in American institutions.

title: ‘Work of fiction’: Will Trump bury US in debt? Even Musk is concerned
content: Donald Trump's 'One Big Beautiful Bill' faces skepticism from Republican senators, international investors, and even Elon Musk, due to concerns about escalating US debt. Despite White House assurances of economic growth, critics highlight rising debt levels following Trump's 2017 tax reductions. Experts warn that increased debt could sustain elevated interest rates, hindering economic expansion and burdening future policymakers.

title: Who is Megha Vemuri, Indian-American student banned from MIT ceremony
content: Megha Vemuri, MIT's Class of 2025 president, was banned from her graduation after delivering a pro-Palestine speech criticizing the university's ties with Israel. MIT cited disruption of an official event as the reason, leading to online backlash and Vemuri deleting her LinkedIn profile. The incident highlights the ongoing tensions surrounding campus activism and free speech related to the Israel-Gaza conflict.

title: US-China trade war may ease as Trump likely to speak to Xi ‘very soon’
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent suggests a potential conversation between President Trump and President Xi Jinping to address trade deal issues. Trump criticized China's alleged breach of a Geneva agreement, while Bessent remains optimistic about resolving differences.

title: IPL 2025 playoffs: What happens if PBKS vs MI Qualifier 2 is washed out?
content: Rain disrupted the Qualifier 2 match between Punjab Kings and Mumbai Indians in Ahmedabad, with PBKS winning the toss and opting to bowl. Yuzvendra Chahal returned to bolster PBKS's bowling, while MI debuted Reece Topley.

title: Photo of Sheikh Hasina's father Mujibur Rahman removed from Bangladesh banknotes
content: Bangladesh has introduced redesigned currency notes, replacing the image of Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, the nation's first president, with landscapes and landmarks. This change coincides with the trial of his daughter, former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, and reflects past alterations influenced by political shifts.

title: Trump shares wild theory claiming former president is a clone
content: Donald Trump amplified a bizarre conspiracy theory on Truth Social, alleging that Joe Biden was executed in 2020 and replaced by a robotic clone. This comes amid increasing scrutiny of Biden's health, fueled by a recent book questioning his fitness for office and a Republican-led probe into his well-being.

title: 'Using cheap language against CM': TMC on Amit Shah's remarks against Mamata
content: Trinamool Congress MP Sagarika Ghose has strongly criticized Union Home Minister Amit Shah for his remarks against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee during his recent visit. Ghose condemned Shah's language, deeming it unbecoming of a home minister and accusing him of employing divisive politics. Shah, in turn, accused Banerjee of turning Bengal into a state of infiltration and violence.

title: This fibre mimics ozempic and can help in dramatic weight loss
content: Research indicates that beta-glucan, a soluble fiber found in oats and barley, may offer weight loss and blood sugar control benefits similar to Ozempic. Studies on mice showed beta-glucan consumption led to weight loss and increased levels of beneficial gut bacteria, promoting the production of GLP-1, an appetite-suppressing hormone.

title: Why Shreyas Iyer opted to bowl first in IPL Qualifier 2 against MI
content: In a crucial Qualifier 2 clash for a spot in the IPL 2025 final, Punjab Kings' Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against Mumbai Indians at Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi Stadium. Iyer's decision was influenced by overcast conditions and the expectation of dew later in the evening.

title: ‘No need for self-praise’: Kharge takes swipe at PM Modi, calls for Parl session
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge has intensified his criticism of Prime Minister Modi regarding Operation Sindoor, urging a special Parliament session. He emphasized national unity and cautioned against political framing of the conflict with Pakistan.

title: After Tharoor row, Salman Khurshid's take on Article 370 fresh headache for Congress
content: Salman Khurshid's recent remarks backing the nullification of Article 370 have stirred unease within the Congress party, especially after Shashi Tharoor's comments on surgical strikes. Khurshid, part of an all-party delegation, defended the abrogation in Indonesia, highlighting the subsequent elections and perceived prosperity in Jammu & Kashmir.

title: Seven killed after bridges collapse onto train in Russia: What we know so far
content: A bridge collapse in Russia's Bryansk region, near the Ukrainian border, resulted in at least seven fatalities and over 70 injuries when a passenger train was struck. Russian authorities are investigating the incident as a possible act of terrorism.

title: Shah Rukh Khan's bold new look with tattoos leaves fans in a frenzy
content: Shah Rukh Khan, known as 'The King' in Bollywood, has ignited social media with a glimpse of his new edgy look. A video showcasing SRK exiting a hotel reveals his muscular physique and bold tattoos, sparking fan speculation about his upcoming film 'King.' This action thriller will also mark Suhana Khan's debut on the big screen, alongside a star-studded cast, with SRK playing a powerful assassin.

title: 'Biggest eye-opener for me in life': DK lauds this RCB player's character
content: Dinesh Karthik praises Rajat Patidar's grounded nature after becoming RCB captain, noting his unchanged behaviour despite increased responsibility. RCB reached the IPL final after nine years, defeating Punjab Kings in Qualifier 1. Mo Bobat highlights Patidar's calm and collaborative leadership, leveraging the experience of senior players.

title: IndiGo doubles wide body order by confirming order for 30 more Airbus A350s
content: IndiGo has doubled its wide-body aircraft order to 60 Airbus A350s, with deliveries starting in 2027. As it ends its wet lease agreement with Turkish Airlines, IndiGo is forging partnerships with Delta, Air France-KLM, and Virgin Atlantic. This collaboration aims to enhance connectivity between India, Europe, and North America, offering travelers broader access and seamless experiences.

title: Diddy trial: List of celebrities mentioned during Sean Combs' sex trafficking case
content: In Sean "Diddy" Combs' ongoing trial, several celebrities have been mentioned during testimony, though none are accused of wrongdoing. Whitney Houston, Mariah Carey, and Mike Myers were referenced in connection to Combs' behavior. Nas, Kelis, French Montana, and others were also named. The trial sheds light on the circle surrounding Combs, who denies all charges of sex trafficking and racketeering.

title: Dhanashree Verma on giving love another chance post divorce - Exclusive
content: Dhanashree Verma is making a strong mark in her career, seamlessly juggling dance, acting, and singing. She is set to make her Telugu film debut with Akasam Daati Vastaava. Unfazed by scrutiny around her personal life, Dhanashree stays focused on her work, self-growth, and maintaining a positive outlook. While she’s open to love, her career remains her top priority as she takes on exciting projects in both Bollywood and Telugu cinema.

title: Who is Glenn Greenwald? Journalist who exposed Edward Snowden
content: Glenn Greenwald, famed for exposing U.S. surveillance, faces a privacy breach as intimate videos surface online. He confirms their authenticity, denounces the leak as politically motivated, and defends his consensual actions. Despite the intrusion, Greenwald remains defiant, emphasizing the weaponization of privacy while continuing his independent journalism on Substack after leaving The Intercept over censorship concerns.

title: Thunderstorms, duststorms sweep through Delhi-NCR bringing relief from heat
content: Delhi-NCR experienced a thunderstorm, heavy rain, and dust storm, offering respite from the heat. While the maximum temperature was near average, rainfall in May has significantly increased since 1901, making it the wettest May on record. Experts attribute these changes to increased thunderstorms, higher moisture levels, and global warming, despite average temperatures remaining consistent.

title: Lord Jagannath’s Kolkata chariot to glide on Sukhoi tyres
content: Kolkata's Iskcon Rath Yatra chariot, carrying Lord Jagannath, will roll on new Sukhoi fighter jet tyres, replacing the old Boeing 747 tyres. This change comes after a steering snag last year and a two-decade search for suitable replacements. The MRF-manufactured tyres will enhance manoeuvrability, safety, and stability, especially on Kolkata's tram-tracked roads, ensuring a smoother Yatra experience.

title: ‘You can take Krishna’s army but not Krishna’: Tej Pratap's emotional note for brother Tejashwi
content: Amidst a family feud, Tej Pratap Yadav expressed loyalty to his brother Tejashwi, likening their bond to Krishna and Arjun. This follows Lalu Prasad Yadav's expulsion of Tej Pratap from the party and family due to alleged misconduct. Tej Pratap also appealed to his parents for support after the expulsion.

title: 'He listened to his heart': De Villiers on why Kohli walked away from Tests
content: In a shocking announcement, Virat Kohli has retired from Test cricket after a stellar 14-year career. AB de Villiers, a close friend, believes Kohli followed his heart. Kohli, 36, played 123 Tests, amassing 9,230 runs with 30 centuries. De Villiers acknowledged the void Kohli leaves, emphasizing his significant legacy in red-ball cricket.

title: ‘Fed her sedative-laced laddoo’: Taekwondo player gang-raped at Kanpur ashram
content: A national-level Taekwondo player has accused four individuals, including temple priests, of gang-raping her inside an ashram in Kanpur's Govind Nagar. The survivor alleges she was drugged with a sedative-laced sweet before the assault, which occurred in January. The accused also allegedly made an obscene video of her and threatened to release it.

title: Odisha engineer held on retirement day for assets worth Rs 15 cr, 483% more than income
content: Baikunthanath Sarangi, a chief engineer, was arrested on his retirement day for amassing disproportionate assets exceeding Rs 15 crore. He was caught on video throwing cash during a vigilance raid. Searches revealed multiple properties, significant cash holdings, and investments. In a separate case, searches were conducted on N Dillip Kumar Choudhury, an assistant executive engineer, for similar allegations.

title: PSG UCL celebrations turn tragic: Two dead, 559 arrested across France
content: Paris Saint-Germain fans celebrated their Champions League victory, resulting in nearly 600 arrests due to clashes with police near the Champs-Elysees. A car incident in Grenoble injured four celebrating fans. Despite the unrest, joyous fans sang and danced, celebrating PSG's historic win. President Macron will host the team, and a victory parade is planned on the Champs-Elysees.

title: Watch: IndiGo pilot shares moment of colleague’s first flight with his parents onboard
content: An IndiGo pilot, Captain Aravind, experienced a heartwarming maiden scheduled flight from Bengaluru to Thiruvananthapuram, celebrated by his parents who were passengers on board. Captain Pradeep Krishnan shared the touching moment on Instagram, showcasing the mid-air announcement and the cabin's applause. Aravind expressed gratitude to his parents for their unwavering support, making the flight a memorable milestone.

title: Gautam Adani says 'Adani Group has become more unbreakable & resilient' amid challenges, scrutiny
content: Gautam Adani asserts the Adani Group's resilience and strategic adaptation amidst acquisitions and scrutiny, planning a $15–20 billion investment over five years. Despite facing allegations from Hindenburg Research and US authorities, the group has reduced debt, attracted investments, and reported record earnings. Adani emphasizes strong governance and compliance, highlighting expansion across various sectors and contributions to India's ambitions.

title: 'We all rise above party politics': Manish Tewari on India's stand against terror
content: Amidst Operation Sindoor, Congress leader Manish Tewari, speaking from Addis Ababa, voiced support for India's firm stance against terrorism, echoing sentiments from other Congress members. This unity emerges even as party president Kharge criticizes the government's handling of recent events. Tewari highlighted Ethiopia's backing of India following the Pahalgam attack, emphasizing strengthened ties and global solidarity against cross-border terrorism.

title: 'Planned systematic attack': B'desh starts trial of Sheikh Hasina
content: Sheikh Hasina's trial commenced in Bangladesh, accusing her of orchestrating a violent crackdown on 2024 protests that resulted in numerous deaths. The prosecution presented evidence of a coordinated attack, while Hasina, in exile, dismissed the charges as politically motivated. Simultaneously, Bangladesh's Supreme Court lifted a ban on Jamaat-e-Islami, adding another layer of complexity to the nation's political landscape.

title: GST collections cross Rs 2 lakh crore for 2nd month in a row
content: GST collections have surpassed Rs 2 lakh crore for the second consecutive month in May 2025, reaching Rs 2.01 lakh crore, a 16.4% increase year-on-year, according to the Ministry of Finance. This follows a record high of Rs 2.37 lakh crore in April.

title: Elderly couple ‘abandoned’ in their Gurgaon flat for 3 years, community steps in
content: In Gurgaon's Ridgewood Estate, concerned neighbors alerted authorities to the plight of an elderly couple allegedly abandoned by their son living abroad. The Haryana Human Rights Commission intervened, ordering a comprehensive assessment after residents reported the couple's distress and lack of proper care.

title: Flash floods, waterlogging hit Agartala, life disrupted; IMD issues heavy rainfall alert
content: Agartala grapples with severe flash floods following incessant monsoon rains, disrupting normal life and prompting the displacement of over 6000 residents. The Chief Minister is monitoring the situation, while the administration has opened relief camps. IMD forecasts continued heavy rainfall, raising concerns about further flooding, landslides, and potential disruptions across Tripura.

title: 'Why did we have to wait for CDS to speak from Singapore?': Cong slams Centre over jets
content: Jairam Ramesh, a Congress MP, raised concerns regarding the government's handling of Operation Sindoor disclosures. He questioned why CDS General Anil Chauhan revealed key details abroad first. Ramesh felt the Defence Minister should have informed Parliament. He compared this to Vajpayee's transparency during the Kargil conflict.

title: Manny Pacquiao is back, but why is he getting a title shot?
content: Manny Pacquiao returns to the ring for the first time in almost four years . the 46-year-old is boxing's only eight-division champion . he last fought in august 2021 when he suffered a loss by unanimous decision to Yordenis Ugas .

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: McDavid is Conn Smythe fave in Panthers rematch
content: the Edmonton Oilers beat the Florida Panthers 3-0 in the last year's Stanley Cup final . Connor McDavid and the Oilers won the next three to force a Game 7 . the oilers defeated their in-state rivals, the Tampa Bay Lightning in the first round, the Toronto Maple Leafs in a seven-game second round .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Notre Dame pushes closer to the top spot
content: Notre Dame has pushed its way into the no. 2 slot of our 2026 class rankings . the Fighting Illini shook off the loss of ESPN 300 CB Victor Singleton quite well . Nasir Rankin , a top-10 athlete in the ESPN 300, is an early in-state priority .

title: Buffalo Bills QB Josh Allen ties knot with actress and singer Hailee Steinfeld
content: Buffalo Bills  quarterback  Josh Allen  made quite the catch, marrying his fiancée, musician and actress Hailee Steinfeld, on Saturday, according to multiple reports. The pair  announced their engagement  in November with the proposal taking place during the Bills' bye week. The following week, Allen described his bye as "fantastic." They were first linked together publicly in the spring of 2023. The reigning MVP quarterback was in attendance and participating in Tuesday's voluntary organized team activities with the Bills, while Steinfeld is coming off the success of her latest film, "Sinners," which surpassed a $200 million domestic total. Coach Sean McDermott was asked whether he had seen any jitters from Allen on Tuesday. "Jitters from Josh? I'm not going to get into any of that," McDermott said. "Good try on that. But he is as confident and as calm, cool and collected as he always is."
